title: Fishing pole
data:
| ) [![Fishing pole.png](/images/0/07/Fishing_pole.png)](/wiki/File:Fishing_pole.png) |                                                         |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                                | fishing pole                                            |
| Appearance                                                                          | fishing pole                                            |
| Damage vs. small                                                                    | 1d2                                                     |
| Damage vs. large                                                                    | 1d6                                                     |
| To-hit bonus                                                                        | +0                                                      |
| Weapon skill                                                                        | [polearm](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm")                      |
| Size                                                                                | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")             |
| Base price                                                                          | 50 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight                                                                              | [30](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                             |
| Material                                                                            | [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron")                               |

A **fishing pole** is a new [weapon-tool](/wiki/Weapon-tool "Weapon-tool") in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), which can be used as a [polearm](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm") weapon. Its main use is to fish. Applying a fishing pole will prompt you for a location. The range of a fishing pole is the same as [pounding](/wiki/Pounding "Pounding") with a regular polearm, but without a minimum range.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Fishing](#Fishing)

  - [1.1 Dry Land](#Dry_Land)
  - [1.2 Sinks and Toilets](#Sinks_and_Toilets)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Combat](#Combat)

- [3 References](#References)

## Fishing

Applying a fishing pole on a water square may have the following effects :

- You hook yourself, dealing yourself 10-19 points of damage.
- You hook an item on the target square, retrieving it.
- You may *"snag some garbage from the water"*, which gives you an uncursed +0 pair of [low boots](/wiki/Low_boots "Low boots"). This can only occur once.
- You catch tonight's dinner, a [cram ration](/wiki/Cram_ration "Cram ration").

### Dry Land

Note that you may still apply a fishing pole to a square when that square is on dry land. Usually, there is no need to do this, as most items may simply be picked up. However, if the item is at the bottom of a [spiked pit](/wiki/Spiked_pit "Spiked pit"), it might be safer to fish for the item than to try your luck with [poisonous](/wiki/Poison "Poison") spikes. Also, for [vampire players](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race\) "Vampire (starting race)") with their intrinsic [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight"), this is one of the few ways available to them to pick up items in the bottom of a pit.

### Sinks and Toilets

You may use a fishing pole on [sinks](/wiki/Sink "Sink") and [toilets](/wiki/Toilet "Toilet"), although this has no special use:

- You hook yourself, dealing yourself 10-19 points of damage.
- You hook an item on the target square, retrieving it.
- You pull a [sewer rat](/wiki/Sewer_rat "Sewer rat") out of the sink, *"Eek! There's a sewer rat there!"*

Generally speaking, it is much faster and safer to simply walk over to the plumbing and pick up the item.

## Strategy

A potentially powerful, albeit slow, use for the fishing pole is to catch a large number of cram rations. Once you've caught as many as you can carry, you can sell them at shops to get gold or [credit](/wiki/Credit "Credit"). Also, keep in mind that you will catch cram rations frequently enough that you will never starve while fishing (unless you're a [vampire](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race\) "Vampire (starting race)")).

### Combat

Fishing poles are not very damaging as weapons. However, since they are light and have no minimum range, you may consider keeping one around instead of another polearm. Since they are fairly rare, you will want to abstain from trying for better than +5/+6, lest your only pole evaporate.

## References

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Someone familiar with SLASH'EM should add references"*

enchant)

Material iron

A fishing pole is a new weapon-tool in SLASH'EM, which can be used as a polearm weapon. Its main use is to fish. Applying a fishing pole will prompt you for a location. The range of a fishing pole is the same as pounding with a regular polearm, but without a minimum range.

Contents

  • 1 Fishing
    • 1.1 Dry Land
    • 1.2 Sinks and Toilets

  • 3 References

Fishing

Applying a fishing pole on a water square may have the following effects :

  • You hook yourself, dealing yourself 10-19 points of damage.

Dry Land

However, if the item is at the bottom of a spiked pit, it might be safer to fish for the item than to try your luck with poisonous spikes. Also, for vampire players with their intrinsic flight, this is one of the few ways available to them to pick up items in the bottom of a pit.

Sinks and Toilets

You may use a fishing pole on sinks and toilets, although this has no special use:

  • You hook yourself, dealing yourself 10-19 points of damage.
  • You hook an item on the target square, retrieving it.
  • You pull a sewer rat out of the sink, "Eek! There's a sewer rat there!"

Generally speaking, it is much faster and safer to simply walk over to the plumbing and pick up the item.

A potentially powerful, albeit slow, use for the fishing pole is to catch a large number of cram rations. Once you've caught as many as you can carry, you can sell them at shops to get gold or credit. Also, keep in mind that you will catch cram rations frequently enough that you will never starve while fishing (unless you're a vampire).

Fishing poles are not very damaging as weapons. However, since they are light and have no minimum range, you may consider keeping one around instead of another polearm. Since they are fairly rare, you will want to abstain from trying for better than +5/+6, lest your only pole evaporate.

=== Dry Land ===

Usually, there is no need to do this, as most items may simply be picked up.

Also, for [[Vampire (starting race)|vampire players]] with their intrinsic [[flight]], this is one of the few ways available to them to pick up items in the bottom of a pit.

=== Sinks and Toilets ===
You may use a fishing pole on [[sink]]s and [[toilet]]s, although this has no special use:

*You hook yourself, dealing yourself 10-19 points of damage.
*You hook an item on the target square, retrieving it.
*You pull a [[sewer rat]] out of the sink, ''"Eek! There's a sewer rat there!"''

Generally speaking, it is much faster and safer to simply walk over to the plumbing and pick up the item.

== Strategy ==

However, since they are light and have no minimum range, you may consider keeping one around instead of another polearm.
Since they are fairly rare, you will want to abstain from trying for better than +5/+6, lest your only pole evaporate.
